title: A uniform disc rotating with constant angular acceleration covers 50 revolutions in the first 5 seconds after the start. What are the angular acceleration and angular velocity at the end of 5 seconds? - Quora

response.answer_text: ¢=w0t+(1/2)(alpha) t²,w0=0,t=5s, theta=50rev=50×2π=100π rad. =>100π=(1/2)(alpha)×5²=>200π=25(alpha) =>(alpha)=8π rad/s².angular velocity w=w0+(alpha)t=>w=0+8π×5=40π rad/s Or 40π/(2π)=20rev/s.Ans..So angular acceleration=8π rad/s²,angular velocity=20rev/s.Ans…
